<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-enableLogsSample">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L400">property <b>enableLogsSample</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>enableLogsSample?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A boolean indicating whether or not to include a list of log values which triggered the alert. This is only used by log
monitors. Defaults to `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-escalationMessage">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L404">property <b>escalationMessage</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>escalationMessage?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A message to include with a re-notification. Supports the `@username` notification allowed elsewhere.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-evaluationDelay">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L411">property <b>evaluationDelay</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>evaluationDelay?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

(Only applies to metric alert) Time (in seconds) to delay evaluation, as a non-negative integer. For example, if the
value is set to `300` (5min), the `timeframe` is set to `last_5m` and the time is 7:00, the monitor will evaluate data
from 6:50 to 6:55. This is useful for AWS CloudWatch and other backfilled metrics to ensure the monitor will always have
data during evaluation.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-forceDelete">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L416">property <b>forceDelete</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>forceDelete?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A boolean indicating whether this monitor can be deleted even if its referenced by other resources (e.g. SLO,
composite monitor).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-includeTags">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L421">property <b>includeTags</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>includeTags?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A boolean indicating whether notifications from this monitor automatically insert its triggering tags into the title.
Defaults to `true`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-locked">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L426">property <b>locked</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>locked?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A boolean indicating whether changes to to this monitor should be restricted to the creator or admins. Defaults to
`false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-message">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L431">property <b>message</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>message: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A message to include with notifications for this monitor. Email notifications can be sent to specific users by using the
same `@username` notation as events.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-monitorThresholdWindows">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L436">property <b>monitorThresholdWindows</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>monitorThresholdWindows?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/datadog/types/input/#MonitorMonitorThresholdWindows'>MonitorMonitorThresholdWindows</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

A mapping containing `recovery_window` and `trigger_window` values, e.g. `last_15m` . Can only be used for, and are
required for, anomaly monitors.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-monitorThresholds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L440">property <b>monitorThresholds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>monitorThresholds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/datadog/types/input/#MonitorMonitorThresholds'>MonitorMonitorThresholds</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

Alert thresholds of the monitor.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-name">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L444">property <b>name</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>name: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Name of Datadog monitor.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-newHostDelay">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L449">property <b>newHostDelay</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>newHostDelay?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Time (in seconds) to allow a host to boot and applications to fully start before starting the evaluation of monitor
results. Should be a non negative integer. Defaults to `300`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-noDataTimeframe">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L454">property <b>noDataTimeframe</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>noDataTimeframe?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The number of minutes before a monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Provider defaults to 10 minutes. We
recommend at least 2x the monitor timeframe for metric alerts or 2 minutes for service checks.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-notifyAudit">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L458">property <b>notifyAudit</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>notifyAudit?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A boolean indicating whether tagged users will be notified on changes to this monitor. Defaults to `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-notifyNoData">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L462">property <b>notifyNoData</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>notifyNoData?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A boolean indicating whether this monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Defaults to false.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-priority">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L463">property <b>priority</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>priority?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-query">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L469">property <b>query</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>query: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The monitor query to notify on. Note this is not the same query you see in the UI and the syntax is different depending
on the monitor type, please see the [API Reference](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/monitors/#create-a-monitor) for
details. Warning: `terraform plan` won't perform any validation of the query contents.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-renotifyInterval">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L474">property <b>renotifyInterval</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>renotifyInterval?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The number of minutes after the last notification before a monitor will re-notify on the current status. It will only
re-notify if it's not resolved.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-requireFullWindow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L480">property <b>requireFullWindow</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>requireFullWindow?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A boolean indicating whether this monitor needs a full window of data before it's evaluated. We highly recommend you set
this to `false` for s metrics, otherwise some evaluations will be skipped. Default: `true` for `on average`, `at all
times` and `in total` aggregation. `false` otherwise.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-silenced">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L488">property <b>silenced</b></a>
</h4>

<div class="note note-deprecated">
<i class="fas fa-exclamation-triangle pr-2"></i><strong>DEPRECATED</strong>
use Downtime Resource instead
</div>
<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>silenced?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;{[key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>]: <span class='kd'><a href='https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/basic-types.html#any'>any</a></span>}&gt;;</code></pre>

Each scope will be muted until the given POSIX timestamp or forever if the value is `0`. Use `-1` if you want to unmute
the scope. Deprecated: the silenced parameter is being deprecated in favor of the downtime resource. This will be
removed in the next major version of the Terraform Provider.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-tags">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L493">property <b>tags</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>tags?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

A list of tags to associate with your monitor. This can help you categorize and filter monitors in the manage monitors
page of the UI. Note: it's not currently possible to filter by these tags when querying via the API

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-thresholdWindows">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L500">property <b>thresholdWindows</b></a>

</div>
<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>thresholdWindows?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/datadog/types/input/#MonitorThresholdWindows'>MonitorThresholdWindows</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

A mapping containing `recovery_window` and `trigger_window` values, e.g. `last_15m`. Can only be used for, and are
required for, anomaly monitors.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-thresholds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L506">property <b>thresholds</b></a>

Alert thresholds of the monitor.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-timeoutH">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L511">property <b>timeoutH</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>timeoutH?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The number of hours of the monitor not reporting data before it will automatically resolve from a triggered state.
Defaults to `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-type">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L517">property <b>type</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>type: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The type of the monitor. The mapping from these types to the types found in the Datadog Web UI can be found in the
Datadog API [documentation page](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/monitors/#create-a-monitor). Note: The monitor type
cannot be changed after a monitor is created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorArgs-validate">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L521">property <b>validate</b></a>

If set to `false`, skip the validation call done during plan.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="MonitorState" data-link-title="MonitorState">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-evaluationDelay">

value is set to `300` (5min), the `timeframe` is set to `last_5m` and the time is 7:00, the monitor will evaluate data
from 6:50 to 6:55. This is useful for AWS CloudWatch and other backfilled metrics to ensure the monitor will always have

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-includeTags">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-locked">

`false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-message">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L299">property <b>message</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>message?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A message to include with notifications for this monitor. Email notifications can be sent to specific users by using the
same `@username` notation as events.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-monitorThresholdWindows">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L304">property <b>monitorThresholdWindows</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>monitorThresholdWindows?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/datadog/types/input/#MonitorMonitorThresholdWindows'>MonitorMonitorThresholdWindows</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

A mapping containing `recovery_window` and `trigger_window` values, e.g. `last_15m` . Can only be used for, and are
required for, anomaly monitors.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-monitorThresholds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L308">property <b>monitorThresholds</b></a>

Alert thresholds of the monitor.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-name">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L312">property <b>name</b></a>

Name of Datadog monitor.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-newHostDelay">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L317">property <b>newHostDelay</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>newHostDelay?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Time (in seconds) to allow a host to boot and applications to fully start before starting the evaluation of monitor
results. Should be a non negative integer. Defaults to `300`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-noDataTimeframe">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L322">property <b>noDataTimeframe</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>noDataTimeframe?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The number of minutes before a monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Provider defaults to 10 minutes. We
recommend at least 2x the monitor timeframe for metric alerts or 2 minutes for service checks.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-notifyAudit">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L326">property <b>notifyAudit</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>notifyAudit?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A boolean indicating whether tagged users will be notified on changes to this monitor. Defaults to `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-notifyNoData">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L330">property <b>notifyNoData</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>notifyNoData?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A boolean indicating whether this monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Defaults to false.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-priority">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L331">property <b>priority</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>priority?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-query">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L337">property <b>query</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>query?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The monitor query to notify on. Note this is not the same query you see in the UI and the syntax is different depending
on the monitor type, please see the [API Reference](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/monitors/#create-a-monitor) for
details. Warning: `terraform plan` won't perform any validation of the query contents.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-renotifyInterval">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L342">property <b>renotifyInterval</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>renotifyInterval?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The number of minutes after the last notification before a monitor will re-notify on the current status. It will only
re-notify if it's not resolved.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-requireFullWindow">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L348">property <b>requireFullWindow</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>requireFullWindow?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

A boolean indicating whether this monitor needs a full window of data before it's evaluated. We highly recommend you set
this to `false` for s metrics, otherwise some evaluations will be skipped. Default: `true` for `on average`, `at all
times` and `in total` aggregation. `false` otherwise.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-silenced">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L356">property <b>silenced</b></a>
</h4>

<div class="note note-deprecated">
<i class="fas fa-exclamation-triangle pr-2"></i><strong>DEPRECATED</strong>
use Downtime Resource instead
</div>
<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>silenced?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;{[key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>]: <span class='kd'><a href='https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/basic-types.html#any'>any</a></span>}&gt;;</code></pre>

Each scope will be muted until the given POSIX timestamp or forever if the value is `0`. Use `-1` if you want to unmute
the scope. Deprecated: the silenced parameter is being deprecated in favor of the downtime resource. This will be
removed in the next major version of the Terraform Provider.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-tags">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L361">property <b>tags</b></a>

A list of tags to associate with your monitor. This can help you categorize and filter monitors in the manage monitors
page of the UI. Note: it's not currently possible to filter by these tags when querying via the API

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-thresholdWindows">

A mapping containing `recovery_window` and `trigger_window` values, e.g. `last_15m`. Can only be used for, and are
required for, anomaly monitors.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-timeoutH">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L379">property <b>timeoutH</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>timeoutH?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The number of hours of the monitor not reporting data before it will automatically resolve from a triggered state.
Defaults to `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-type">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/monitor.ts#L385">property <b>type</b></a>

The type of the monitor. The mapping from these types to the types found in the Datadog Web UI can be found in the
Datadog API [documentation page](https://docs.datadoghq.com/api/v1/monitors/#create-a-monitor). Note: The monitor type
cannot be changed after a monitor is created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="MonitorState-validate">

If set to `false`, skip the validation call done during plan.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="ProviderArgs" data-link-title="ProviderArgs">

    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>ProviderArgs</span></code></pre>

The set of arguments for constructing a Provider resource.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ProviderArgs-apiKey">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/provider.ts#L62">property <b>apiKey</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>apiKey?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

(Required unless validate is false) Datadog API key. This can also be set via the DD_API_KEY environment variable.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ProviderArgs-apiUrl">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/provider.ts#L68">property <b>apiUrl</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>apiUrl?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The API Url. This can also be set via the DD_HOST environment variable. Note that this URL must not end with the /api/
path. For example, https://api.datadoghq.com/ is a correct value, while https://api.datadoghq.com/api/ is not. And if
you're working with "EU" version of Datadog, use https://api.datadoghq.eu/.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ProviderArgs-appKey">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/provider.ts#L72">property <b>appKey</b></a>
</h4>

(Required unless validate is false) Datadog APP key. This can also be set via the DD_APP_KEY environment variable.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ProviderArgs-validate">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/provider.ts#L77">property <b>validate</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>validate?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Enables validation of the provided API and APP keys during provider initialization. Default is true. When false, api_key
and app_key won't be checked.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ScreenBoardArgs-height">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceLevelObjectiveArgs-forceDelete">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/serviceLevelObjective.ts#L282">property <b>forceDelete</b></a>

-   `thresholds`: (Required) - A list of thresholds and targets that define the service level objectives from the provided SLIs.

are: `metric` and `monitor`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SyntheticsTestState-deviceIds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/syntheticsTest.ts#L496">property <b>deviceIds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>deviceIds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Array with the different device IDs used to run the test. Allowed enum values: `laptop_large`, `tablet`, `mobile_small`
(only available for `browser` tests).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SyntheticsTestState-locations">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/syntheticsTest.ts#L502">property <b>locations</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>locations?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Array of locations used to run the test. Refer to [Datadog
documentation](https://docs.datadoghq.com/synthetics/api_test/#request) for available locations (e.g.
`aws:eu-central-1`).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SyntheticsTestState-message">

A message to include with notifications for this synthetics test. Email notifications can be sent to specific users by
using the same `@username` notation as events.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="SyntheticsTestState-tags">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="UserArgs-accessRole">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-datadog/blob/7169429ad73f674dfb6999252d3e5e0e48a03daa/sdk/nodejs/user.ts#L262">property <b>accessRole</b></a>
</h4>

<div class="note note-deprecated">
<i class="fas fa-exclamation-triangle pr-2"></i><strong>DEPRECATED</strong>
This parameter is replaced by `roles` and will be removed from the next Major version
</div>
<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>accessRole?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Role description for user. Can be `st` (standard user), `adm` (admin user) or `ro` (read-only user). Default is `st`.
`access_role` is ignored for new users created with this resource. New users have to use the `roles` attribute.
